title: Changes to match history and API regarding unranked games
body:
**TL;DR: We’re updating the Riot Games API policy so third party websites can once again display your Normal game data. Match history will be changed so it’s consistent with the API.**

* What exactly does this mean for my Normal stats?

Here’s how each system is being changed:

1) *Match history in-client and website*
You’ll be able to view anyone’s unranked match history instead of just friends’.

2) *Riot Games API*
Developers will be able to display match history for unranked games as they would ranked games (*meaning they can again access normal stats*), with a few policy considerations to make sure the data is not abused.

* Unranked data was available before. Why did it change in the first place?

Back in 2014, we decided unranked game data should only be available to your friends.

We broke it down like this: ranked games should be a matter of public record, unranked should be visible to you and your friends, and customs are just for you. You can read that announcement here: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/features/announcing-new-match-history-beta

As part of this decision, we wanted to ensure that third party developers were not publicly showing any unranked data. We didn’t enforce this decision until the old client was deprecated a couple years later (which is why [this thread](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/6o2kxp/normal_game_stats_are_going_away/) came up).

* Why are we reverting now?

We think the benefit of transparency outweighs the risk of revealing unranked data. It’s been accessible on third party sites for some time, and we haven’t seen any significant worrying trends™. Many players primarily play unranked games, and those players want to be able to track their stats and scout their opponents. All players should have access to the compelling experiences third party devs create with the API.  

* What’s changing for third party sites?

We’ll revise the [Developer Portal](https://developer.riotgames.com/policies/data-policies.html) data policies on the aggregation and display of unranked games and add guidelines on how this data should be used.

For example, community developers are free to list unranked match history, but not to use any data to shame players (like a Worst Teemo NA site or something).

The policy will also state that any third party challenges or contests should always be healthy for the game. “Win five games as Jhin” is cool. “Extend the game to 60 minutes in solo queue” is not.

Developers can display aggregated statistics to provide win rates, KDA, or other measures of player performance, but the queues used to aggregate these stats must be clearly identified. For example, if devs wanted to display a player’s Fiora stats they’d need to identify which queues were used to determine their win rate, KDA, etc.

* What about custom games?

Custom game history will still only be visible to you.

* When does this change come into effect?

Sometime during patch 7.17!

I always knew that “Win five games as Jhin” is cool !

Win five games as Jhin is not cool.

Win four games as Jhin ... now we have something {{champion:202}}

> We broke it down like this: ranked games should be a matter of public record, unranked should be visible to you and your friends, and customs are just for you. You can read that announcement here: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/features/announcing-new-match-history-beta.

The link isn't working for me, it just says Error 404. Could it just be because I'm from EUW or...?

> [{quoted}](name=Death Rex,realm=EUW,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=V0BgNcOQ,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2017-08-18T20:41:08.573+0000)
>
> The link isn't working for me, it just says Error 404. Could it just be because I'm from EUW or...?

Remove the . at the end of the URL and it should work
Just to confirm, if I had an application that read data from games generated by Tournament Code, that will also be sorted when this change goes live correct?

No worries there. There's always been an exception filter in place to allow custom games built by the Tournament Code API to still be looked up, regardless of any of the above issues, either before or after now.
Thats awesome to hear! I was a little concerned as some of my calls weren't functioning properly after the API changes went through, but maybe thats my own code being a little silly.
If you want, swing by our developer community Discord and some of your fellow devs or us Rioters who hang out in there might be able to help you troubleshoot: http://discord.gg/riotapi
Actually been in there for a little bit! I'll ask around after I do a bit of refactoring, thank you :D

Are you serious !

Revenancer : << “Win five games as Jhin” is cool >> 

JHIN CANT ACCEPT IT 

{{champion:202}} {{champion:202}} {{champion:202}} {{champion:202}}
Woot! I originally got interested in the Riot API because I wanted to know more about my normal games, this is awesome!
So will we be able to see the names of other summoners in non ranked games again?
Yep!

Better have a toggle for this. I don't want people to see my shit thank you very much. Personally you should be PRIVACY settings ALREADY for RANKED AND NORMS. 

Don't want people to see your rank? Done. Don't want people to see your history? DONE. No one can. So stupid...
Will you please let unranked (normal MMR) to be affected by ranked games too? I'm sick of normal games with diamond vs silver.

I might be in the minority, but I'd actually prefer my normals data to not be public (not that I'm at all anyone good/notable). I don't really like the idea of all my data being accessible/public to all sorts of 3rd party websites there for anyone to look up, though I do understand Riot's stance on competitive integrity/transparency in ranked. Is there any chance of Riot meeting people like me in the middle and adding some sort of option to opt out and send back anonymized data in normal games instead?
I mean this information until just recently was already available for everyone if they wanted to look. So I don't really see how it's any different from now to before.

I came to this thread through google search to see if the changes were implemented so I could start playing normal games anxiety-free. Pretty sad that the vocal side that was against this change won.

As someone with 2000+ co op vs ai games, I was excited to finally be able to enjoy playing pvp without the pressure of KDA and Win/Lose ratios. I strongly agree with Riot's initial stance, that normal games should be treated as a fun pick-up games.  That ranked should be the place for hardcore players.

Back to Co op vs AI for me I guess. And it sucks, because it's plagued with botting accounts nowdays.  I easily find 1 or 2 botters every single game.

Why does Win/lose ratios or KDA matter? and it being shown in your match history doesn't really matter does it? The worst thing that happens is that someone looks down at you? But then again there are probably people who would look down at you simply for playing coop vs ai games so there still that?

> any significant worrying trends™.

Wow I didn't know Riot had "trends" trade marked!
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

I'm all for having a history of all our matches available for anyone to see, but has opting out of public match histories ever been a thing in consideration? Sometimes, moving to different servers and changing your in game name is not enough to hide from someone.
Are we going to be able to watch replays of other players?
What I'm worried about is whether champion rankings, I.E. best Gangplanks NA, also are counted as worst if they rank all players.  That's kind of a cop-out if so.
Will the available info only be going forward or from all time?

Thank you Riot

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Thanks Riot <3
We Appreciate the pivot.
Any word on if or when we'll get the more expansive ranked stats in the new client? I really miss them
can i watch replays of other Players?
If you are on losing streak in normal now people will know and normal games will be just as toxic and competitive as ranked games. This is total bullshit.
Your last 20 games (ranked or not) were already available. If anyone cared to know what kind of streak you were on, they already had that info from sites like op.gg

This data has been available to people for a long time and only recently since shortly before the last patch was changed to be hidden.  Just report toxic people anyway.  Anyone looking at normal games to shame people are just trolling for a reason to tilt you anyway.
